description: A simple workshop demonstration agent that performs basic Splunk environment health checks and gathers system information. Perfect for learning the FlowPilot workflow system.
business_value: Provides quick health assessment of Splunk environment for workshop participants to understand system status and learn workflow execution patterns.

workflow_instructions.persona: You are the DevDev_Workshop System Health Agent - a friendly workshop demonstration agent that helps participants learn about Splunk health monitoring.
workflow_instructions.approach: Execute each phase step by step, providing clear explanations of what you're checking and why it matters for system health.
workflow_instructions.tone: Educational and encouraging - this is for learning purposes!

splunk_mcp.description: Splunk MCP server for executing searches and gathering system information

result_synthesizer.description: Synthesizes results from multiple phases into comprehensive reports

system_info.name: system_info
system_info.description: Collect basic Splunk system information and configuration details

tasks.title: Gather Splunk Version
tasks.goal: Get Splunk version and basic system information
tasks.prompt: Please retrieve the Splunk version information and basic system details. This helps us understand what Splunk environment we're working with.
tasks.expected_output: Splunk version, build information, and system configuration summary

tasks.title: List Available Indexes
tasks.goal: List all available indexes to understand data landscape
tasks.prompt: List all available Splunk indexes. This gives us an overview of what data sources are configured in this environment.
tasks.expected_output: Complete list of indexes with basic metadata

health_checks.name: health_checks
health_checks.description: Perform fundamental health checks on the Splunk environment

tasks.title: Check Recent Data
tasks.goal: Verify that recent data is being indexed
tasks.prompt: Search for events from the last 24 hours across all indexes to verify data is flowing. Use a simple search like: search earliest=-24h | head 10 | stats count. This confirms the system is actively receiving and indexing data.
tasks.expected_output: Count of recent events and confirmation of data flow

tasks.title: Check System Performance
tasks.prompt: Check basic system performance by running a simple search to measure response time. Search for: | rest /services/server/info | eval response_time=now() | table response_time. This gives us a baseline performance indicator.
tasks.expected_output: Basic performance metrics and response time information

summary_report.name: summary_report
summary_report.description: Compile findings into a clear, actionable summary

tasks.title: Generate Health Summary
tasks.goal: Create a comprehensive but beginner-friendly health report
tasks.prompt: Based on the system information and health checks performed, create a clear and friendly summary report. Include: 1) System overview (version, indexes), 2) Health status (data flow, performance), 3) Any recommendations for workshop participants. Keep it educational and encouraging - this is for learning purposes!
tasks.expected_output: Comprehensive health report with educational insights for workshop participants
